definitions.text: a swindle in which you cheat at gambling or persuade a person to buy worthless property
cause to move furtively and hurriedly
examples: The secret service agents hustled the speaker out of the amphitheater

definitions.text: move or cause to move energetically or busily
examples: The cheerleaders bustled about excitingly before their performance

definitions.text: sell something to or obtain something from by energetic and especially underhanded activity

examples: she hustled a free lunch from the waiter

definitions.text: pressure or urge someone into an action
